ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Eat and enjoy yourselves for a little while. You are evildoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Eat and enjoy for a while: You are certainly sinners.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Eat and enjoy yourselves for a while. Surely you are evil-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Disbelievers), eat and enjoy yourselves for a little while. You are certainly sinful ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Eat and enjoy for a while – indeed you are guilty.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Eat and enjoy yourselves for a little while. Verily, you are criminals.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Eat and enjoy yourselves for a little; surely you are guilty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Eat and take your joy a little; you are sinners!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Eat and take your ease (on earth) a little. Lo! ye are guilty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Eat [your fill] and enjoy your life for a little while, O you who are lost in sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Eat and enjoy a little; verily ye are culprits.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘Eat and enjoy a little! You are indeed guilty.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (O ye unjust!) Eat ye and enjoy yourselves (but) a little while, for that ye are Sinners.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (O you disbelievers)! Eat and enjoy yourselves (in this worldly life) for a little while. Verily, you are the Mujrimun (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Eat and enjoy yourselves a little, for you are sinners'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “Eat and enjoy yourselves a little; you are indeed criminals.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [77:46] ‘Eat and enjoy — addressing the disbelievers in this world — for a little, time, at the end of which comes   death — this is meant as a threat for them. Indeed you are guilty!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Eat) disbelievers (and take your ease a little) in the life of the world. (Lo! ye are guilty) you are idolaters and your destination in the Hereafter will be the Fire. This is a threat to them from Allah.
